intro: Catanthera keris, commonly known as the African sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or arid regions. Catanthera keris is adapted to harsh environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
